name: Sharks and Rays
fact1: Sharks are the only fish with eyelids
fact2: Sharks are found in almost every ocean habitat
fact3: Fossil records date stingrays back to the Jurassic period, 150 million years ago

name: Crustaceans
fact1: Lobsters urinate out of their face and they urinate on each other to communicate
fact2: Crabs have taste buds on their feet
fact3: Lobsters can re-grow an eye or an arm

name: Mammals
fact1: Sperm whales are the loudest animals on earth
fact2: Sea otter pups are born with buoyant fur that does not allow them to sink
fact3: Sea mammals with flippers are called pinnipeds

name: Fish
fact1: Oarfishes are the longest bony fish in the world, reaching 8 meters in length
fact3: Infantfish are the smallest fish in the world, reaching 8 millimeters in length

name: Birds
fact2: Seabirds have desalinization glands that let them drink sea water
fact3: Adelie Penguin feces are pink and they are visible from space

name: Squids, Octopuses and Cephalopods
fact2: Octopuses live in dens made out of rocks which they build
fact3: The Thai Bobtail Squid is the world's smallest squid averaging 0.4 inches

name: Reptiles and Amphibians
fact1: Marine iguanas are the only marine lizard species in the world
fact2: Adult saltwater crocodiles have 66 teeth on average and the greatest bite pressure of any animal in the world
fact3: When sea turtles sleep, they can slow their heart rate as slow as 4 beats per minute to conserve oxygen

name: Oceans
fact1: The Mariana Trench is the deepest part of the ocean floor reaching depths of 10,984 meters
fact2: The Ocean is subdivided into 5 smaller oceans: Antarctic, Atlantic, Pacific, Indian, and Arctic
fact3: Much of the world's oxygen is created by phytoplankton and algae
